intro: Helleborus abchasicus var. flore-luteolo, commonly known as the Abchazian hellebore, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Abkhazia. It is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and striking yellow to orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is part of the Ranunculaceae family and is known for its toxic properties, containing various alkaloids. It thrives in cool, moist, and shaded environments, often found in forested areas. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
